subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Audio recordings of the letters?
messageBody:
On Aug 6, 2017, at 4:18 PM, jcdietrich@... [Read_Alphabet] <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com> wrote:


I am new to this and am having a hard time distinguishing between some of the vowels. I suspect my difficulty lies with the fact that I do not pronounce words the same as Read. (I'm Canadian) Has anyone created a recording of the various letters being spoken, along with their examples?



I'd check http://adiabatic.github.io/Configuratronic-Quikscript-Cheat-Sheet/ to get the IPA values for the letters and then head off to Wikipedia to look them up. Searching for "ɔ" there led me to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_O which led me to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open-mid_back_rounded_vowel. Once you're there, you can see all the other vowels on the chart. Deep in the table at the bottom of the page you can hear a person saying "not" in English.

Since you're Canadian, you might be interested in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canadian_raising. Since you're not an old Englishman or -woman, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phonological_history_of_English_high_front_vowels#Happy_tensing might help explain why Read made .Low .It much faster to write (all one stroke!) than .Low .Eat.

Hope this helps,
Nathan
